name: Warner Leisure Hotels Nidd Hall Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a 3 night stay at Nidd Hall 8-11 Feb 2008 and the entertainment (Sounds of the 4 Tops band, comedian, singers, in-house entertainment) was very good. Ambassador room and bathroom was very clean and comfortable . There was tuition available in salsa dancing, line dancing, archery, and rifle shooting in addition to use of the lovely indoor pool, steam, sauna and jacuzzi. This was our third visit and Nidd Hall has beautiful grounds and is a great location for visiting nearby Harrogate, Ripon and York. We did find that the food choice (being vegetarians) was limited compared to previous visits but still more than adequate. Staff were very friendly and helpful particularly in the dining room.
reviews.title: Warner Break - 4 Tops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very enjoyable stay at Nidd Hall. Room was Ambassador Plus which was very nice, clean and tidy.Food was excellent. A wide choice and lots of it.Service very good.Leisure facilities also very good.Gardens to walk around were clean and tidy.Car parking facilities were limited at the East Wing but found plenty of spaces in the South Wing which is nearer the entrance.During our stay only a maximum of 3 cars in it at any time.(out of season tho).
reviews.title: Excellent Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Central to lots of towns and places of interest and not too far to visit the Dales. York only 18 or so miles away.
reviews.title: Great Time At Nidd Hall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, an excellent stay. Good value for money
reviews.title: A lovely relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just back from NIDD HALL,glad we did not take notice of some of the reviews,we had a excellent
reviews.title: hotel or holiday camp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed @ Nidd Hall for a recent Boogaloo Blues weekend & thoroughly enjoyed our stay, although like other reviewers found the let down was the food. Breakfasts are excellent, as ther is plenty of choice although the scrambled egg looked more like porridge! Dinners were just "OK" , & there could be more thought on the veggie side i.e not so many root vegetables. Fruit juices as starters & omelettes seem to have also been dropped from the menu. Nidd Hall is a beautiful hotel with lovely grounds. Sadly Warners have droped the Blues weekends from this hotel next year so we won't be able to go back again.
reviews.title: Blues Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just come back from a short stay at Nidd Hall 15th August 07and have to say we were a little disappointed. The location and surrounding area is lovely and the hotel itself is very nice. We had a superior room which I couldn't fault.
reviews.title: Lovely Location - Shame about the food!

likes.liked: — The superior room was lovely and the entertainment very good

description: Nidd Hall is a jewel of Georgian splendour set in 45 acres of landscaped gardens. Enjoy the elegant charms of this Grade II Historic Hotel, perched on the edge of the Yorkshire moors. Midweek and Weekend breaks inclusive of breakfast and 3-course dining, live evening entertainment and extensive leisure activities.
